title: Accessibility Atlas
subtitle: 42 datasets on disability, employment, web accessibility, and assistive tech
description:
# Accessibility Atlas

42 datasets covering disability demographics, employment gaps, web accessibility compliance, assistive technology patents, special education, healthcare, housing discrimination, transportation, government benefits, and more -- across 15 categories.

Built for researchers, journalists, policy analysts, and anyone building tools for disabled communities.

## What's Inside

- **US Disability Demographics**: 8 Census Bureau datasets (county, state, national trends)
- **Employment**: BLS, FRED, EEOC, JAN data on the employment gap
- **Special Education**: 6 IDEA/NCES datasets (7.5M students)
- **Web Accessibility**: WebAIM Million, Section 508, ADA lawsuits, screen reader surveys
- **International**: WHO, OECD, Eurostat, World Bank data (194+ countries)
- **Government Benefits**: SSA SSDI/SSI, VA disability compensation
- **Healthcare**: CMS Medicaid, SAMHSA mental health
- **Housing**: HUD fair housing complaints
- **Transportation**: NTD paratransit data
- **Assistive Tech**: WIPO patent data
- **Visual Accessibility**: VizWiz VQA dataset

## Key Findings

- 44.1 million Americans (13.4%) have a disability
- Disabled workers: 24.5% labor force participation vs ~67% without
- 94.8% of top 1M websites fail WCAG
- Disability is #1 basis for fair housing complaints (~55%)
- 7.5M students served under IDEA
- 190 countries signed UN CRPD

## Notebooks

10 Jupyter notebooks for analysis and visualization.

## Sources

Most data is from US government (public domain) and international organizations (open licenses). Individual datasets carry their own licenses - see README for full source table.

- Census Bureau ACS
- Bureau of Labor Statistics
